page.title: 13The Miner's Strike
page.content: March 6th 1984 the pit strike begins,after the{NCB}tell the miners that pit closures amounting to 20,000jobs being lost will occur in British pits.{Arthur Scargill}is pressed by right-wingers to hold a national ballot,he rejects it. The pit strike starts because of the proposed closures of Cortonwood and Bulcliffe Wood pits. Many pits follow suit and soon after a national pit strike has solidly hit Britain.{Notts miners stayed working as they thought pit closures should not affect there pits anyway. Picketing at major pits and at the{Orgreave}coking plant soon brings picket line violence.
